层次聚类

class habit.core.habitat_analysis.algorithms.hierarchical_clustering.HierarchicalClustering(n_clusters: int | None = None, linkage: str = 'ward', affinity: str = 'euclidean', random_state: int = 0, **kwargs)[源代码]

Hierarchical Clustering implementation

Parameters:

n_clustersint, optional (default=None)

The number of clusters to find. If None, it will be determined by find_optimal_clusters method

linkagestr, optional (default=’ward’)

The linkage criterion to use. The linkage criterion determines which distance to use between sets of observation. The algorithm will merge the pairs of cluster that minimize this criterion. - ‘ward’ minimizes the variance of the clusters being merged - ‘complete’ or ‘maximum’ linkage uses the maximum distances between all observations of the two sets - ‘average’ uses the average of the distances of each observation of the two sets - ‘single’ uses the minimum of the distances between all observations of the two sets

affinitystr, optional (default=’euclidean’)

Metric used to compute the linkage. Can be ‘euclidean’, ‘l1’, ‘l2’, ‘manhattan’, ‘cosine’, or ‘precomputed’.

calculate_calinski_harabasz_scores(X: ndarray, cluster_range: List[int]) → ndarray[源代码]

Calculate Calinski-Harabasz scores for different numbers of clusters

参数:

  • X – np.ndarray Input data of shape (n_samples, n_features)

  • cluster_range – List[int] List of cluster numbers to evaluate

返回:

np.ndarray

Calinski-Harabasz scores for each number of clusters

返回类型:

scores

find_optimal_clusters(X: ndarray, min_clusters: int = 2, max_clusters: int = 10, methods: List[str] | None = None, show_progress: bool = True) → Tuple[int, Dict[str, ndarray]][源代码]

Find the optimal number of clusters

参数:

  • X – np.ndarray Input data of shape (n_samples, n_features)

  • min_clusters – int, optional (default=2) Minimum number of clusters to consider

  • max_clusters – int, optional (default=10) Maximum number of clusters to consider

  • methods – List[str], optional (default=None) List of methods to use for determining optimal clusters

  • show_progress – bool, optional (default=True) Whether to show progress during calculation

返回:

int

Optimal number of clusters

scoresDict[str, np.ndarray]

Dictionary of scores for each method

返回类型:

best_n_clusters

DBSCAN

class habit.core.habitat_analysis.algorithms.dbscan_clustering.DBSCANClustering(eps: float = 0.5, min_samples: int = 5, metric: str = 'euclidean', algorithm: str = 'auto', random_state: int = 0, **kwargs)[源代码]

DBSCAN Clustering implementation

Parameters:

epsfloat, optional (default=0.5)

The maximum distance between two samples for one to be considered as in the neighborhood of the other

min_samplesint, optional (default=5)

The number of samples (or total weight) in a neighborhood for a point to be considered as a core point

metricstr, optional (default=’euclidean’)

The metric to use when calculating distance between instances in a feature array - ‘euclidean’ - ‘manhattan’ - ‘cosine’ - etc.

algorithmstr, optional (default=’auto’)

The algorithm to be used by the NearestNeighbors module to compute pointwise distances and find nearest neighbors - ‘auto’ - ‘ball_tree’ - ‘kd_tree’ - ‘brute’

calculate_calinski_harabasz_scores(X: ndarray, eps_range: List[float]) → ndarray[源代码]

Calculate Calinski-Harabasz scores for different eps values

参数:

  • X – np.ndarray Input data of shape (n_samples, n_features)

  • eps_range – List[float] List of eps values to evaluate

返回:

np.ndarray

Calinski-Harabasz scores for each eps value

返回类型:

scores

  • max_eps – float, optional (default=1.0) Maximum eps value to consider

  • n_eps – int, optional (default=10) Number of eps values to evaluate

  • methods – List[str], optional (default=None) List of methods to use for determining optimal eps

  • show_progress – bool, optional (default=True) Whether to show progress during calculation

返回:

Optimal eps value

返回类型:

Spectral Clustering

class habit.core.habitat_analysis.algorithms.spectral_clustering.SpectralClustering(n_clusters: int | None = None, affinity: str = 'rbf', gamma: float = 1.0, n_neighbors: int = 10, eigen_solver: str = 'arpack', random_state: int = 0, **kwargs)[源代码]

Spectral Clustering implementation.

参数:

  • n_clusters (int, optional) – The number of clusters to find. If None, it will be determined by find_optimal_clusters method.

  • affinity (str, optional, default='rbf') –

    How to construct the affinity matrix.

    • ’nearest_neighbors’: construct the affinity matrix by computing a graph of nearest neighbors.

    • ’rbf’: construct the affinity matrix using a radial basis function (RBF) kernel.

    • ’precomputed’: interpret X as a precomputed affinity matrix.

    • ’precomputed_nearest_neighbors’: interpret X as a sparse graph of precomputed distances.

  • gamma (float, optional, default=1.0) – Kernel coefficient for rbf, poly, sigmoid, laplacian and chi2 kernels.

  • n_neighbors (int, optional, default=10) – Number of neighbors to use when constructing the affinity matrix using the nearest neighbors method.

  • eigen_solver (str, optional, default='arpack') – The eigenvalue decomposition strategy to use. ARPACK can handle both sparse and dense problems, while ‘lobpcg’ is recommended for very large and sparse problems.

calculate_calinski_harabasz_scores(X: ndarray, cluster_range: List[int]) → ndarray[源代码]

Calculate Calinski-Harabasz scores for different numbers of clusters

参数:

  • X – np.ndarray Input data of shape (n_samples, n_features)

  • cluster_range – List[int] List of cluster numbers to evaluate

返回:

np.ndarray

Mean Shift

class habit.core.habitat_analysis.algorithms.mean_shift_clustering.MeanShiftClustering(bandwidth: float | None = None, seeds: ndarray | None = None, bin_seeding: bool = False, min_bin_freq: int = 1, cluster_all: bool = True, random_state: int = 0, **kwargs)[源代码]

Mean Shift Clustering implementation

Parameters:

bandwidthfloat, optional (default=None)

Bandwidth used in the RBF kernel. If not given, the bandwidth is estimated using sklearn.cluster.estimate_bandwidth

seedsarray, shape=[n_samples, n_features], optional (default=None)

Seeds used to initialize kernels. If not set, the seeds are calculated by clustering.get_bin_seeds with bandwidth as the grid size and default values for other parameters

bin_seedingbool, optional (default=False)

If true, initial kernel locations are not locations of all points, but rather the location of the discretized version of points, where points are binned onto a grid whose coarseness corresponds to the bandwidth

min_bin_freqint, optional (default=1)

To speed up the algorithm, accept only those bins with at least min_bin_freq points as seeds

cluster_allbool, optional (default=True)

If true, then all points are clustered, even those orphans that are not within any kernel. Orphans are assigned to the nearest kernel. If false, then orphans are given cluster label -1

calculate_calinski_harabasz_scores(X: ndarray, bandwidth_range: List[float]) → ndarray[源代码]

Calculate Calinski-Harabasz scores for different bandwidth values

参数:

  • X – np.ndarray Input data of shape (n_samples, n_features)

  • bandwidth_range – List[float] List of bandwidth values to evaluate

返回:

np.ndarray

Calinski-Harabasz scores for each bandwidth value

返回类型:

scores

返回类型:

find_optimal_clusters(X: ndarray, min_bandwidth: float = 0.1, max_bandwidth: float = 1.0, n_bandwidth: int = 10, methods: List[str] | None = None, show_progress: bool = True) → Tuple[float, Dict[str, ndarray]][源代码]

Find the optimal bandwidth value for Mean Shift

参数:

  • X – np.ndarray Input data of shape (n_samples, n_features)

  • min_bandwidth – float, optional (default=0.1) Minimum bandwidth value to consider

  • max_bandwidth – float, optional (default=1.0) Maximum bandwidth value to consider

  • n_bandwidth – int, optional (default=10) Number of bandwidth values to evaluate

  • methods – List[str], optional (default=None) List of methods to use for determining optimal bandwidth

  • show_progress – bool, optional (default=True) Whether to show progress during calculation

返回:

float

Optimal bandwidth value

scoresDict[str, np.ndarray]

Dictionary of scores for each method

返回类型:

best_bandwidth

Affinity Propagation

class habit.core.habitat_analysis.algorithms.affinity_propagation.AffinityPropagationClustering(damping: float = 0.5, max_iter: int = 200, convergence_iter: int = 15, preference: float | None = None, affinity: str = 'euclidean', **kwargs)[源代码]

Affinity Propagation Clustering implementation

Parameters:

dampingfloat, optional (default=0.5)

Damping factor between 0.5 and 1

max_iterint, optional (default=200)

Maximum number of iterations

convergence_iterint, optional (default=15)

Number of iterations with no change in the number of estimated clusters that stops the convergence

preferencearray-like, shape (n_samples,) or float, optional (default=None)

Preferences for each point - points with larger values of preferences are more likely to be chosen as exemplars. The number of exemplars, i.e. of clusters, is influenced by the input preferences value. If the preferences are not passed as arguments, they will be set to the median of the input similarities

affinitystr, optional (default=’euclidean’)

Which affinity to use. At the moment ‘precomputed’ and ‘euclidean’ are supported. ‘euclidean’ uses the negative squared euclidean distance between points

fit(X: ndarray) → AffinityPropagationClustering[源代码]
